backend/main.mo: Motoko canister defining recipe data models, in-memory storage, and public APIs to add, fetch, and filter bilingual recipes by cuisine or category, with initial seeding on upgrade.
feature_evidence.json: Machine-readable report mapping implemented product features to frontend files, components, test requirements, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten high-level summaries of all frontend source files, used as documentation or planning reference.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS base styles and OKLCH color tokens defining the food-themed design system for light and dark modes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that mounts the React application and loads the main TypeScript bundle.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React application configuring TanStack Router routes, global layout with header/footer, language provider, and toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Sticky navigation header with logo, Explore and New Recipe actions, and a global Hindi/English language toggle.
frontend/src/components/PhotoAssetPicker: Form component that lets users select a recipe image from predefined static photo assets using a radio grid.
frontend/src/components/RecipeCard.tsx: Clickable card component displaying a recipeâ€™s image, localized title/description, category, cuisine, and key metadata.
frontend/src/components/RecipeFiltersBar: Search and filter bar with text search and category/cuisine dropdowns for narrowing the recipe list.
frontend/src/components/RecipeForm.tsx: React form component for creating a recipe with bilingual (English/Hindi) fields, metadata inputs, category/cuisine selectors, and photo asset selection, managing local form state and submission.
frontend/src/components/RecipeMetadata.t: Displays recipe metadata such as category, cuisine, prep/cook time, and servings, with card and detail variants using badges, icons, and localized labels.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches a backend actor based on the current Internet Identity, using React Query and invalidating dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity authentication context, managing login/logout, persisted identity loading, login status flags, and integration with Dfinity AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Collection of React Query hooks for fetching, searching, and mutating recipes via the backend actor, including get-all, get-by-id, add-recipe, and client-side search.
frontend/src/i18n/LanguageProvider.tsx: Context provider for application language state (English/Hindi), exposing a toggle function and a translation helper based on string keys.
frontend/src/i18n/strings.ts: Centralized dictionary of English and Hindi translations for UI labels, categories, cuisines, and common application text.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS setup defining design tokens, color themes, light/dark mode variables, and base typography styles for the application.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app and wraps it with React Query and Internet Identity providers, and imports global styles.
frontend/src/pages/ExplorePage.tsx: Implements the main explore page that fetches and displays all recipes in a responsive grid with a hero section, search, and category/cuisine filters, supporting bilingual text. Handles loading states with skeletons and empty results messaging.
frontend/src/pages/NewRecipePage.tsx: Provides a page for creating a new recipe using a form, submitting bilingual recipe data and metadata via a mutation hook. Shows success/error toasts and navigates back to the explore page after completion or cancel.
frontend/src/pages/RecipeDetailPage.tsx: Displays detailed information for a single recipe, including image, bilingual title/description, metadata, ingredients, and step-by-step instructions. Handles loading and missing-recipe states and allows navigation back to explore.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind CSS with dark mode support, content paths, custom container settings, extended color tokens driven by CSS variables, typography, animations, and UI-focused plugins.
project_state.json: Stores high-level project metadata, including schema/version info, a summary of the Yammy Nevliya recipe website, implemented features, and pending feature requests with requirement references.
